Judul: LARUTAN KALIUM KLORIDA EUTEKTIK SEBAGAI BAHAN BERUBAH FASE UNTUK PENYIMPANAN DINGIN IKAN JANGKA PENDEK
Abstrak:
Around 90 to 95% of Indonesian fishers are small-scale fishers, which means that
they are equipped with fishing vessels with 10 GT (gross ton) or less capacity. This
condition makes them unable to have freezers to store fish or ice makers to make
ice on board. Therefore, they usually bring ice to store fish. Due to the high use of
ice after harvesting fish, ice becomes a significant expense in their profession. Ice
is not reusable, since it’s thrown away after it melts into water. More ice is added
after some or all of the ices melt, which therefore increases their expenses.
An alternative solution for fish cold storage by using Phase Change Material (PCM)
is proposed in this research. Phase change material, if contained properly, is
reusable. Eutectic potassium chloride (KCl) solution is used as PCM, which has the
mixture of 19.5% (wt.%) KCl. This PCM melts at ?10.7 °C, which is suitable to be
used as cold storage medium, and has high heat of fusion of 253 kJ/kg. The eutectic
KCl solution is contained in an aluminium-foil zip-lock bags as the containment to
keep it from leakages and prevent it from contamination with fish. Each pouch
contains 670 grams of PCM. Two Polystyrene boxes, each with 53 L of volume,
are used as a simulation of fish cool box used by fishermen or fish collectors. These
boxes contain different cold storage medium to store fish, which can be the eutectic
solution or ice with two configurations: ice contained inside the same pouches used
for KCl solution, and ice cubes (or ice flakes). Organoleptic test is also performed
to measure fish quality.
The result shows that cool box equipped with the PCM pouches has steady
temperature of around 0 to 3 °C, which holds for 18 to 24 hours, depends on the
indoor or outdoor placement of the box. The PCM itself has steady temperature of
around ?11 °C, which is around the theoretical phase-change temperature.
Moreover, the overall fish quality stored inside the PCM box is kept fresh better
than the ones stored inside box filled with either ice inside pouches or ice cubes.
Although the difference is not huge for 24 hours of storage, for longer fish storage
(2 to 3 days) the fish quality could be significantly different.
Kata Kunci: Cold storage; Fish storage; Phase Change Material; Potassium Chloride; Eutectic
